instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans full speed
threads.message:
Board came dead with a short on (<CAPACITOR>C3521</CAPACITOR> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>) and no USB data on that same side, after replacing <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> I now have data, board boots but fans spin at full speed, when checking sensors I get that heatpipe sensor is high temp, already tried a new heatsink and checked the board for knocked components or corrosion but no luck.

Please advice.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans full speed
threads.message:
The ALS works correctly?
You can try disconnecting camera flex from T-CON board.
Also test with known good trackpad board/flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans full speed
threads.message: I put this board on a different case/screen/battery basically a board swap on another know good case and same thing happens.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans full speed
threads.message: Check if something else appears starting in Diagnostic mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans full speed
threads.message: D mode comes up with error code PFM006 SMC problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans full speed
threads.message:
Temperature sensors are listed on page 54.
Check for broken trace, or knocked off components.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans full speed
threads.message: Thanks a lot, Thermal sensor <CHIP>U5850</CHIP> had a tiny bit of corrosion, this was closed to where the short was.
